benchmark_details.name: MatTools
benchmark_details.overview: MatTools is a benchmark designed to evaluate the proficiency of large language models (LLMs) in answering materials science questions and generating functional Python code for materials property calculations.
benchmark_details.data_type: question-answer pairs and Python code generation tasks

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized framework for assessing and improving LLM capabilities for materials science tool applications.

data.source: Derive from pymatgen codebase and documentation; include generated examples and real-world tool usage datasets.
data.annotation: Generated through automated synthesis and LLM interactions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the proportion of correct responses and executable code rate.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better performance and understanding of materials science tools by LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: General-purpose LLMs outperform domain-specific models by achieving accuracies above 80%.
methodology.validation: Results validated through multiple evaluation runs and usage of Docker sandbox for code execution.
